unnormalised: Entertainment News: Music Streaming Wars Heat Up - Can Gaana Survive the Bollywood Onslaught?
normalised: Entertainment News: Music Streaming Wars Heat Up - Can G A A N A Survive the Bollywood Onslaught?

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 - The digital sangeet scene is getting spicy! Music streaming platforms are battling it out like a Karan Johar movie, complete with dramatic entrances and background scores. Gaana, the homegrown desi champ, is facing stiff competition from global giants like Spotify and Apple Music, all vying for the ears (and data) of 1.4 billion Indians.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six - The digital sangeet scene is getting spicy! Music streaming platforms are battling it out like a Karan Johar movie, complete with dramatic entrances and background scores. G A A N A, the homegrown desi champ, is facing stiff competition from global giants like Spotify and Apple Music, all vying for the ears (and data) of one point four billion Indians.

unnormalised: Rumour has it that BITS Pilani alumni are working overtime to optimize algorithms, trying to predict exactly which Honey Singh song we desperately need at 3 AM. Sources say that Saregama Carvaan sales have dipped slightly, but let's be honest, nothing beats the charm of retro Kishore Kumar on a portable radio for your dada-dadi.
normalised: Rumour has it that B I T S Pilani alumni are working overtime to optimize algorithms, trying to predict exactly which Honey Singh song we desperately need at three A M. Sources say that Saregama Carvaan sales have dipped slightly, but let's be honest, nothing beats the charm of retro Kishore Kumar on a portable radio for your dada-dadi.

unnormalised: Analysts predict that the platform with the most Bollywood exclusive rights (a la Dharma Productions) will emerge victorious. Will Gaana survive? Will someone finally invent a streaming service that doesn't auto-play at full volume when you least expect it? Only time (and data usage) will tell! Stay tuned, folks. It's more dramatic than Bigg Boss.
